protected_spaces_details.description: Provision for children and young people

description: Redevelopment of former school site by the erection of a 3-storey residential building and a part 3 and 4-storey residential building, and the retention/alteration of the existing locally-listed building, to provide 146 private residential flats; provision of private and communal residential amenity space, parking provision (for 87 cars and 146 cycles), servicing and vehicular access from Featherstone Road and installation of renewable energy generation equipment (in conjunction with associated redevelopment of the Former Salisbury Road Depot site consisting of the erection of a 3 storey residential building, and a part 3 and 5 storey residential building to provide 103 residential flats (43 private and 60 affordable) private and communal residential amenity space, parking provision (for 76 cars and 69 cycles), servicing and vehicular access from Salisbury Road, renewable energy generation equipment, and the provision of roof mounted telecommunications equipment to replace the existing telecommunications mast on the Endsleigh Industrial Estate
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment'. | Prior to the first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved details indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment' | Full details of the hard and soft landscaping to be undertaken within the site shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority. This hard and soft landscaping shall be subject to a landscape management plan for a period of 5 years, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | The car parking, disabled car parking and cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any of the residential flats hereby approved, the parking spaces shall be kept continuously available for car, cycle and disabled car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, disabled car parking and cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of noise attenuation measures and associated ventilation within the residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be incorporated into the residential buildings. The submitted detail shall meet the following standards of the Council as detailed within Supplementary planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration':  +   Bedrooms - not greater than 30dB(A)Leq,1hr (23-00 - 07-00 hours)  +   Bedrooms - individual noise events not greater than 45 dB LAmax (fast time weighting) +   Living rooms and dining rooms - not greater than 35dB(A)Leq,1hr (07-00 -23-00 hours)  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration). | Details of a refuse and recycling management plan for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use on the first occupation of the development permitted and shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage). | There shall be no obstruction above 0.6m in height at any time within pedestrian visibility splay areas at the back line of the footway / access road that measure 1.5m deep and 1.5m wide at either side of the vehicular access point to the site. The new access shall be constructed before any of the residential flats hereby approved are first occupied and this visibility splays shall be permanently retained in the form described in this condition, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of a site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  -   On-site construction worker parking -   Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -   Delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) -   Dust suppression measures -   Wheel washing provisions -   Site security -   Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. -   Details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices -   Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | Prior to the first occupation of the residential flats hereby approved, details of the children's play area including information about the type of surfacing materials, boundary treatment and play equipment (which shall include at a minimum of 6 pieces of play equipment) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the residential flats hereby approved, and shall be retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure that there are adequate outdoor children's facilities on the site to help achieve a healthy and balanced quality of life for the future child residents of the development in accordance with policies 3.5, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Greater London Authority SPD (Providing for Children and Young People's Play and Informal Recreation). | Details of works to ensure compliance with the provisions of Secured by Design' in accordance with the Council's Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 'Safer Ealing', shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and completed in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: In the interests of crime prevention and the safety and security of users of the site, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | A BS:4142 industrial type noise assessment including details protecting the dwellings from external industrial/commercial type noise sources from the adjacent coach yard site including noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10: Noise and Vibration. | Details of on site renewable energy generating equipment and energy efficiency measures to be incorporated into the development and to achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions of 20%, calculated based on carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations plus the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (i.e. regulated and un-regulated) shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and the approved sustainability measures shall be implemented and operational prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the manufacturers specification thereafter  Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 4A.1 Tackling Climate Change, 4A.3 Sustainable Design and Construction, 4A.6 Decentralised Energy: Heating, Cooling and Power and 4A.7 Renewable Energy of the London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations since 2004) 2008, Planning and Climate Change - Supplement to Planning Policy Statement 1 (PPS1) and PPS22. | The undercroft car parking spaces for the residential units, including the disabled spaces, ramps and associated access and manoeuvring space, as indicated on the approved drawings shall be laid out, surfaced and marked out and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby permitted and thereafter these facilities shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose except with the prior written permission of the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car and cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | The surface access road and turning area and parking spaces and associated works shall be completed and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter these areas shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site and manoeuvring within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | Details to demonstrate that the proposed new-built building(s) will attain high-energy efficiency and minimum impact to the environment to at least Code Level 3 of the Code for Sustainable Homes, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be permanently retained.  The details submitted shall include:  + A Design Stage Assessment showing the design specifications for each individual dwelling determining the design stage or interim rating + Details of how the development will achieve at least 25% (Code Level 3) reduction in CO2 emissions below the level of emissions that would result from the predicted total energy demand, through the use of on-site renewable energy or low carbon technologies. The amount of carbon emissions derived from the development and how they are proposed to be dealt with to ensure that the development has a significant carbon dioxide emission savings or results to be carbon neutral need also to be demonstrated into the assessment.  + A Post Construction Stage Assessment that determines the final score for the dwelling As Built and its achieved Code Level demonstrating the results from all the proposed measures taken to ensure that the development achieves at least Code Level 3.   Reason: To ensure the development's commitments to sustainability through the implementation of high energy efficiency measures and sustainable technologies in accordance with policies 4A.3 Sustainable Design and Construction, 4A.7 Renewable Energy of the London Plan (2008), and government advice set out in PPS1, Planning and Climate Change - Supplement to Planning Policy Statement 1 and PPS22. | Details of obscured or tinted glazing for the first and second floor windows in the west elevation of Block D shall be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the construction of block D above ground floor level. The obscured or tinted glazing  as approved must be installed prior to the first use of the building and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The residential accommodation shall provide in accordance with the approved drawings at least 10% of the proposed units to enable occupation by disabled residents and the provision of all of the properties designed to Lifetime Homes Standards.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | A landscape management plan relating to all of the soft landscaping within the site for a period of 5 years from the completion of the approved planting of the site shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. This submission shall include long-term design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for the communal areas and details intended use of the landscaped areas. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | The refuse and recycling facilities shall be provided and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby permitted and thereafter these facilities shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose except with the prior written permission of the local planning authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage). | A revised Green Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of residents and visitors to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The approved Green Travel Plan shall be implemented on first use of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained in operation thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter, an annual monitoring report shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise requested.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 21: Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans | Prior to the commencement of any development on site a site drainage scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved drainage scheme shall be implemented on the site prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority   Reason: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with policies 2.1 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of development approved by this planning permission (or such other date or stage in development as may be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority), the following components of a scheme to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site shall each be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the local planning authority:  1.A preliminary risk assessment, which has identified: + All previous uses + Potential contaminants associated with those uses + A conceptual model of the site indicating sources, pathways and receptors + Potentially unacceptable risks arising from contamination at the        site.   2.   A site investigation scheme, based on (1) to provide information for a detailed assessment of the risk to all receptors that may be affected, including those off site.  3. The site investigation results and the detailed risk assessment (2) and, based on these, an options appraisal and remediation strategy giving full details of the remediation measures required and how they are to be undertaken.   4.	A verification plan providing details of the data that will be collected in order to demonstrate that the works set out in (3) are complete and identifying any requirements for longer-term monitoring of pollutant linkages, maintenance and arrangements for contingency action.  Any changes to these components require the express consent of the local planning authority. The scheme including remediation and decontamination measures shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details. The LPA shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination to the LPA for approval.  Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect any archaeological remains on site in accordance with policy 4.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information contained on the submitted plans details of window design, position and glazing type, balcony design for all windows on the western elevation of block D, and the and south elevation of block M shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the construction above ground level of blocks D & M. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of the surrounding properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment'. | No new windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be constructed in the western elevation of blocks M, N & P at any time without the prior express consent of the local planning authority.   Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | No part of the roof of the buildings shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:  1193:P:001J (Ground Floor Plan), 1193:P:002F (First Floor Plan), 1193:P:003F (Second Floor Plan), 1193:P:004F (Third Floor Plan), 1193:P:005G (Roof Plan), 1193:P:101A (Elevation 1-1), 1193:P:102B (Elevation 2-2), 1193:P:103A (Elevation 3-3), 1193:P:104A (Elevation 4-4), 1193:P:105A (Elevation 5-5 & 6-6), 1193:P:106B (Elevation 7-7, 8-8, 9-9), 1193:P:107A (Elevation 10-10 & 11-11), 1193:P:108A (Elevation 12-12)-Design and Access Statement, Stanford Eatwell Associates, Aug 09, Planning Statement, RPS, Aug 09, Sustainability Statement, RPS, Aug 09, Daylight and Sunlight Assessment, BVP, Sept 09, Transport Assessment and Travel Plan, WSP, Sept 09, Environmental Noise Report, Paragon, Sept, Renewable Energy Strategy, HBS, July 09  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
